ruleset.name: Apex Code Style Rules
ruleset.description: Custom rules for Apex code style and formatting

rule.name: PreferStringJoinOverConcatenation
rule.message: Multiple string concatenations with common separator should use String.join()

property.name: xpath
property.value: //BinaryExpression[ @Op = '+' and BinaryExpression[@Op = '+'] and LiteralExpression[@LiteralType = 'STRING'] and count(.//LiteralExpression[@LiteralType = 'STRING']) >= 3 ][ let $strings := .//LiteralExpression[@LiteralType = 'STRING']/@Image, $lastString := $strings[last()], $otherStrings := $strings[position() < last()], $suffixes := for $s in $otherStrings return if (string-length($s) > 0) then substring($s, string-length($s)) else '' return count(distinct-values($suffixes)) = 1 and string-length($suffixes[1]) > 0 and not(ends-with($lastString, $suffixes[1])) ]
